official-title.#text:
To require notification when personally identifying information is disclosed by a Government
			 agency, and for other purposes.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

committee-name.#text: Committee on Oversight and Government Reform

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text: Notification of disclosure of personal information by agencies

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
finds that when personally identifying information is obtained through an agency by an
			 entity outside of the Government without the knowledge of the individual
			 it pertains to, it may constitute an unwarranted invasion of personal
			 privacy, and such individual should be notified that the information was
			 accessed in order to be afforded the opportunity to respond.

shall establish and oversee policies and
			 procedures that require an agency to send a written notification to any
			 individual whose personally identifying information is accessed by a
			 private entity, not later than 30 calendar days after the information was
			 accessed. Such letter shall identify the information accessed and the name
			 of the entity who accessed the information.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Director of the
			 Office of Management and Budget

text.#text: Not later than the first October 1 after the date of the enactment of this Act, the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Director of the Office of Management and Budget

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: from sources including a driver’s license and voter registration; and

text.#text: may obtain the contact information used to notify an individual by letter described in
may not obtain such contact information from the

term.#tail: has the meaning given that term in

means any information about an individual maintained by an agency that is not already public
			 information, including, without limitation, education, financial
			 transactions, medical history, and criminal or employment history, and
			 information that can be used to distinguish or trace the identity of an
			 individual, such as a social security number, date and place of birth,
			 mother’s maiden name, and biometric records.

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 HR 5202 IH: Personal Information Notification Act
